intro: Racosperma inops, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acacia, is a small shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, globular clusters, which are typical of the genus Racosperma. It has a woody stem and is adapted to dry, sandy soils, making it a common sight in arid regions. The plant is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
